abstract: Obama administration announces that National Security Agency will no longer be permitted to keep old phone records used to analyze links between callers in search of terrorism suspects after Nov 29, 2015.
lead_paragraph: Legislation in June directed the agency to stop collecting Americans’ calling data after 180 days, but did not say what would happen to the data already collected.

headline.main: N.S.A. Will Not Be Allowed to Keep Old Phone Records
headline.print_headline: N.S.A. Will Not Be Allowed to Keep Old Phone Records

snippet: Legislation in June directed the agency to stop collecting Americans’ calling data after 180 days, but did not say what would happen to the data already collected.
